content.question:
A large online retailer places packed and ready-to-be-shipped boxes in a line on a conveyor belt. A sample of boxes will be used to estimate the mean weight of boxes shipped on a given day. One proposed method for selecting the sample is as follows:

Generate a random integer from <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Use that integer to select an initial box from the first <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> boxes in line on the conveyor belt.

Select every <math alttext="twenty fifth" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mtext>th</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> box that follows the initial box on the conveyor belt for the rest of the day.

Which of the following best describes the proposed sampling method?

choices.label: Stratified random sample, stratified by time of day
Cluster sample, with times of day as clusters
Cluster sample, with box weights as clusters

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Describe an appropriate method for gathering and representing data.
